intro: Agelaea thouarsiana, commonly known as the Madagascar agelaea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Agelaea thouarsiana is often found in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat.
